Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2009 03:50PM homealone wrote: Hi Joyce I also had a lumpectomy and rads 5 years ago only to find I have a second primary in the other breast diagnosed in May.Just like you there was really no decision to be made other than have a bilateral mastectomy,even though I was offered another lumpectomy.I came home on Monday and although I feel very sad right now I think I have made the right decision.If only I had a bilateral mastecomy 5 years ago I would not be in this position today,hindsight is a wonderful thing.My understanding is that once I have physically recovered from my surgery then life should continue as normal.I am sure you would not have to give up your golf,just delay it for a while until you recover.Anyway I am sure your results will be B9 so don't cross your bridges before you come to them.I will pray that everything turns out well for you.
